tr.td: Complete this form for: Any person in whom a health care worker suspects measles or rubella infection or a patient with fever and rash. The health worker should attempt to collect epidemiological and clinical data , as well as a blood sample , on the first contact with the patient. This contact with the patient might be the only one.

text.value: Complete this form for: Any person in whom a health care worker suspects measles or rubella infection or a patient with fever and rash. The health worker should attempt to collect epidemiological and clinical data , as well as a blood sample , on the first contact with the patient. This contact with the patient might be the only one.
Section I: Identification of the Reporting Institution
Name of the mother or guardian
If date of birth is unknown, age
Section IV: Clinical Data; Follow-up & Treatment
If Yes, duration of the rash(in days)
If Yes, Place where birth will likely take place
Date specimen was sent to lab
If virus was detected, specify viral genotype: (Measles: A, B1, B2, B3, C1, C2, D1, D2, D3, D4, D5, D6, D7, D8, D9, D10, E, F, G1, G2, G3, H1, H2. Rubella: 1a, 1B, 1C, 1D, 1E, 1F, 1g, 2A, 2B, 2c)
If Yes, Number of suspect cases detected during active case-search
Was the patient in contact with any pregnant woman?
Are there other cases present in the case’s municipality of residence?
Did the patient travel outside his/her province/state of residence 7-23 days before rash onset?
Number of doses given during ring vaccination
If yes, what % of vaccinated persons was found?
Were the contacts followed for up to 30 days after the date of the rash onset of the case?
If yes, date of the last day of contact follow-up
If Imported or Import-related, Country of importation
For confirmed cases, Source of infection
Contact of (or epidemiologically-linked to) case number
